intro: Hieracium albocostatum, commonly known as the white-streaked hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive white or pale green stripe running along the central vein. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Hieracium albocostatum is native to Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world, where it can become invasive in certain regions.
